page.title: 20Changing Times, Kinbrace
page.content: In later years fewer people were employed on the estates because of mechanisation and because in the past wages were much lower. Christmas parties were still well attended and the local hall was packed with young and old. A mobile cinema brought entertainment. The station closed. Television came on the scene. With the advent of motor cars people went elsewhere for pleasure and the Hall was no longer used. During the summer months divinity students lived at Kinbrace. They visited our school and homes and encouraged people to attend church. Nowadays the Hall is rotting away.The Church cannot afford to send students. Only six people attend church. Only two children from Kinbrace attend our school.
